Birsk (Russian: Бирск; Bashkir: Бөрө: Birsk was founded in 1663 and granted town status in 1781. From 1865 to 1919 it was part of Ufa Governorate.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
Börö; Tatar: Бөре: Birsk serves as the administrative center of Birsky District
Böre) is a town in the Republic of Bash: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
102 kilometers (63 mi) from Ufa: incorporated separately as the town of republic significance of Birsk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
the capital of the republic. Population: the town of republic significance of Birsk is incorporated within Birsky Municipal District as Birsk Urban Settlement.
